name: psychically
content:
psychically adverb
(SPECIAL ABILITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to a special mental ability, for example being able to know what will happen in the future or know what people are thinking: Perhaps you are more receptive psychically than you realize. He thought could sense something psychically.
More examplesFewer examplesThose who were psychically sensitive would occasionally be able to tune in to other dimensions.She felt she had become psychically blind.There are those who claim to be able to tell you psychically just who you were and what sort of life you had in a previous existence.

psychically adverb
(MENTALLY)
in a way that relates to the mind rather than the body: If we're not physically exhausted, we're psychically exhausted. They were victims of crimes that left them psychically scarred. See
psychic
More examplesFewer examplesViewers are somewhat psychically battered by the traumatic news stories they see.We now live in an interconnected world and seldom stop and think about how it's changing us psychically and physically.Followers of a cult can become psychically damaged.
